page.title: 08WHIXLEY HOSPITAL
page.content: Whixley Hospital was built in 1903 to 1906.It was built on a Roman site called a barfs.It was a sort of burial ground.It was built for inebriates but in the first world war it was used for keeping soldiers.The patients they have are mentally handicapped.They have 132 patients and 130 staff.In the day they learn to do art and craft. Some people assemble ballbearings. Others help staff make beds. They are not locked in. The hospital may close in about 8 years so that the inmates can be in a community not a hospital. The hospital owns some property in Green Hammerton and Whixley. They have trees round the grounds for land- scaping. Sometimes the patients go on trips to Butlins or away with relatives. The hospital is the biggest employer in the area.
